activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12970
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad I'd like to work on this issue.

**Proposed Solution:**
I'll implement input validation for integer and decimal fields so that users entering invalid values (like "e") will see a clear error message like "Please enter a valid number" instead of "This field is required".

**This will include:**
- Using appropriate input types and validation rules
- Showing custom error messages
- Adding test cases if needed

ETA: 1 day from assignment

Please assign this to me if it looks good...!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12971
activity.text: @Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad , I'd love to take up this issue. I’ve already looked into the code and identified exactly where the change is needed — so I’m ready to go with a clear and consistent fix. **I noticed:** - The Date of Birth field lives inside the PatientRegistration component, rendered within the block. - Even though it’s a required field (alongside Age as an alternative), the UI currently doesn’t show the * indicator, which might mislead users. **My Solution:** - Add a red asterisk (*) next to both the Date of Birth and Age labels using the same visual style (text-red-500) already used across the form. - Also update the tab labels (TabsTrigger) to reflect that both DOB and Age are required options (i.e., at least one must be filled). - Leave all existing validation logic as-is — the schema already handles the requirement correctly. **ETA:** I can raise a clean and tested PR within a few hours of assignment. Could you please assign this issue to me??

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12919
activity.text: Hi @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan — I’d like to work on this issue. **My Approach**: - I located the relevant timestamp rendering inside the `MessageItem` within the `EncounterNotesTab` . - It currently uses `formatRelative` from `date-fns` along with a `title` attribute for absolute datetime. - I’ll replace that with the existing `RelativeDateTooltip` component to ensure consistent and reusable relative date formatting across the app. ETA: 1 Day after assignment Please let me know if I’m good to proceed or if there are any additional components where this change should be applied..!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12800
activity.text: @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan @Janetmaria I'd like to work on this issue. **Proposed Solution:** To prevent future dates from being selected in the **Authored On** field within medication requests, I'll: 1. **Update the `DateTimeInput.tsx` component**: - Add a `max` attribute to the input field. - Dynamically set its value to the current datetime using `new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 16)` (if the input type is `datetime-local`). 2. **Add validation logic** in the form submit handler to prevent submission if a future date is detected, even via dev tools tampering. 3. **Testing**: - Ensure the max datetime is correctly rendered. - Try selecting a future date manually and verify that it's blocked. **Expected Timeline:** - **ETA**: 1 day after assignment. Let me know if this approach looks good. Looking forward to contributing!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12713
activity.text:
As mentioned earlier, the double-border issue was due to overlapping `outline` and `border` styles on focus. I've made the following changes to address this:

### Change Made:
- Disabled the default browser focus outline by adding `outline-none focus:outline-none`.
- Ensured a consistent border style on focus using `focus-visible:ring-0` and `focus:border-primary-400` (for brand consistency).
- Applied this fix in the `Input`.

ETA: 1 Day

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8c37456-afca-4e54-b845-09d2e8214f5c

Can you please assign this issue to me?

@AdityaJ2305 @rithviknishad I would like to work on this issue..!

**Proposed Solution:**

- I will replace the native HTML <select> element in the language selector on the profile page with the ShadCN <Select> component.

**Implementation Steps:**

- Import ShadCN's components.
- Map through the available languages.
- Will Refer to other usages of ShadCN Select in the codebase to ensure consistent styling.

ETA: 1 day from assignment.

If approved, kindly assign this issue to me. Thank you!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12693
activity.text:
@nihal467 I'm interested in working on this issue and would like to contribute a fix.

**Proposed Solution:**

I wanted to work on this by updating the validation logic to allow medicine administration, when the administration timestamp is equal to or later than medicine added .Hence, this includes modifying the date comparison logic in the form validation (to use appropriate comparison operator).

**Expected Timeline:**

End Date: June 26,2025

This fix avoids false validation errors.
